remarks: Multiplicative property of the prime count pre-function.  Note that the primality of ` P ` is essential for this property; ` ( 4 pCnt 2 ) = 0 ` but ` ( 4 pCnt ( 2 x. 2 ) ) = 1 =/= 2 x. ( 4 pCnt 2 ) = 0 ` .  Since this is needed to show uniqueness for the real prime count function (over ` QQ ` ), we don't bother to define it off the primes. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.)
statement:
pcpremul.1 $e |- S = sup ( { n e. NN0 | ( P ^ n ) || M } , RR , < ) $.
pcpremul.2 $e |- T = sup ( { n e. NN0 | ( P ^ n ) || N } , RR , < ) $.
pcpremul.3 $e |- U = sup ( { n e. NN0 | ( P ^ n ) || ( M x. N ) } , RR , < ) $.
pcpremul $p |- ( ( P e. Prime /\ ( M e. ZZ /\ M =/= 0 ) /\ ( N e. ZZ /\ N =/= 0 ) ) -> ( S + T ) = U ) $.
$d M n $.
$d N n $.
$d P n $.
